text: Job’s Second Speech: A Response to Eliphaz
“Does not ⸤a human being\f + \fr 7:1 \ft Or a collective singular, “human beings” \f* have hard service⸥\f + \fr 7:1 \ft Literally “hard service for a human being” \f* on earth?
And \add are not\add* his\f + \fr 7:1 \ft Or a collective singular, “their” \f* days like the days of a laborer?
Like a slave he longs for \add the\add* shadow,
and like a laborer he waits for his wages.
So ⸤I had to inherit⸥\f + \fr 7:3 \ft Literally “I am allotted to me” \f* months of worthlessness,
and nights of misery are apportioned to me.
When I lie down, I say,\f + \fr 7:4 \ft Hebrew “and I say” \f* ‘When shall I rise?’
But\f + \fr 7:4 \ft Hebrew “And” \f* \add the\add* night is long,
and I have my fill of tossing until dawn.
My body is clothed \add with\add* maggots and clods of dust;
my skin hardens, then\f + \fr 7:5 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* it gives way \add again\add*.
“My days are swifter than a weaver’s shuttle,
and they come to an end ⸤without hope⸥.\f + \fr 7:6 \ft Literally “with nothing hope” \f*
Remember that my life \add is\add* a breath;
my eye will not return to see good.
The eye of \add the one\add* seeing me will not see me;
your eyes \add are\add* upon me, but\f + \fr 7:8 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* ⸤I will be gone⸥.\f + \fr 7:8 \ft Literally “there is not me,” or “I am not” \f*
A cloud vanishes, and it goes away,
so \add he who\add* goes down to Sheol will not come up.
He does not return again to his house,
and his place does not recognize him again.
“Even\f + \fr 7:11 \ft Or “I on my part” \f* I will not restrain my mouth;
I will speak in my spirit’s anguish;
I will complain in my inner self’s\f + \fr 7:11 \ft Or “soul’s” \f* bitterness.
Am I \add the\add* sea, or a sea monster,
that you set a guard over me?
When I say, ‘My bed will comfort me,
and my couch\f + \fr 7:13 \ft Or “bed” \f* will ease my complaint,’
then\f + \fr 7:14 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* you terrify me with dreams,\f + \fr 7:14 \ft Or “the dreams” \f*
and with visions you terrify\f + \fr 7:14 \ft Or “dishearten,” or “frighten” \f* me.
So\f + \fr 7:15 \ft Or “And” \f* my inner self\f + \fr 7:15 \ft Or “soul” \f* will choose\f + \fr 7:15 \ft Or “I will choose” \f* strangling—
death more than my ⸤existence⸥.\f + \fr 7:15 \ft Literally “bones” \f*
I loathe \add my life\add*; I would not live forever;
depart from me, for my days \add are\add* a breath.
“What \add is\add* a human being that you make him great
and that ⸤you fix your mind on him⸥,\f + \fr 7:17 \ft Literally “you set on him your heart” \f*
so that\f + \fr 7:18 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* you visit him ⸤every morning⸥,\f + \fr 7:18 \ft Literally “for mornings,” or “at mornings” \f*
you test him ⸤every moment⸥?\f + \fr 7:18 \ft Literally “for moments,” or “at moments” \f*
⸤How long⸥\f + \fr 7:19 \ft Literally “Like what” \f* will you not turn away from me?
\add Or\add* not leave me alone until I swallow\f + \fr 7:19 \ft Or “my swallowing” \f* my spit?
\add If\add* I have sinned, what have I done to you, watcher of humanity?
Why have you made me as a target for yourself,
so that\f + \fr 7:20 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* I have become a burden to myself?\f + \fr 7:20 \ft Some translations translate as “you” (e.g., ESV, NRSV, NIV, NET) \f*
And why do you not pardon my transgression
and take away my guilt?
For now I shall lie in the dust,
and you will seek me, but\f + \fr 7:21 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* ⸤I will be no more⸥.”\f + \fr 7:21 \ft Literally “there is not me,” or “I am not” \f*
